title: Beach House's '7' is a Dreamy Masterpiece
summary: Elizabeth sings about reminiscing about that special moment when it all began with lines like “Reminding you of something you forgot.” “Dark Spring” is the perfect blend of the Beach House we know and love and the change we saw on their last two albums. “Lemon Glow” carries some of the melodies from “Bloom”, Beach House’s first album released in 2008. The sixth track on the album is a beautiful love song that feels like the perfect end to the first half of the album.

This is track number one and the title track, a perfect introduction to Beach House\u2019s take on dream pop on this record. It\u2019s a song about the start of a relationship. Elizabeth sings about reminiscing about that special moment when it all began with lines like \u201CReminding you of something you forgot.\u201D \u201CDark Spring\u201D is the perfect blend of the Beach House we know and love and the change we saw on their last two albums."),mdx("p",null,"The second track on the album is \u201CDive.\u201D This is the first single from the album released back in October of 2018. \u201CDive\u201D is one of the more upbeat songs on the album and one of the best as well. It\u2019s a song about falling in love, with lyrics like \u201CYou fell in love with the sound of the ocean.\u201D This song is a great example of how this album is both nostalgic and fresh at the same time. Something Beach House do so well."),mdx("p",null,"The third track on the album is the second single released, \u201CLemon Glow\u201D. This is one of the more electronic-sounding songs on the album and the first instance of Beach House\u2019s trademark layered harmonies coming through. This is also the first hint of nostalgia that comes from this album, as \u201CLemon Glow\u201D carries some of the melodies from \u201CBloom\u201D, Beach House\u2019s first album released in 2008."),mdx("p",null,"The fourth track on the album is \u201CSkipping\u201D. This is another one of the more upbeat songs and a return to the Beach House we know and love. This song isn\u2019t about falling in love like others on the album, it\u2019s about staying in love."),mdx("p",null,"The fifth track on the album is \u201CGirl of the Year\u201D. This is one of the more interesting choices of song order on the album. It\u2019s one of the slower songs but it has a lot of energy. It\u2019s about the anxiety of being in a relationship and feeling like you\u2019re being held back by the girl you love."),mdx("p",null,"The sixth track on the album is \u201CDrinking Coffee\u201D. This is a beautiful love song that feels like the perfect end to the first half of the album. This song is about reminiscing on the moments that brought you together and feeling lucky someone is in your life. It\u2019s a beautiful song with a catchy chorus, great guitar riffs and a simple yet effective drum beat."),mdx("p",null,"The seventh track on the album is \u201CLurking\u201D. This is one of the more \u201Cout there\u201D tracks on the album, mostly thanks to the synthesizer-heavy instrumental. This song is about the moments that make you feel anxious, like waiting for a phone call or a text from someone."),mdx("p",null,"The eighth track on the album is \u201CTremendous Darkness\u201D. This is a slower and more moody track about accepting the feelings we have that we aren\u2019t always proud of. It\u2019s a song about knowing that you can\u2019t always hide from the things that make you feel bad, but you also can\u2019t let them control you."),mdx("p",null,"The ninth and final track on the album is \u201CDays of Candy\u201D. This is a softer and more minimal track compared to the rest of the album. It\u2019s a song about the things you do to distract yourself from your own thoughts and how easy it is to forget how short life can be. It\u2019s a very sweet and thoughtful way to end the album."),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CDark Spring\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,'"Dive."'),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CLemon Glow\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CSkipping\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CGirl of the Year\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CDrinking Coffee\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CLurking\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CTremendous Darkness\u201D"),mdx("h2",null,"\u201CDays of Candy\u201D"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Haim's 'Something to Tell You' Is a Delightful Pop Album

intro.compiledSource:
var m=Object.defineProperty,c=Object.defineProperties;var d=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var i=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,r=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var u=(e,t,o)=>t in e?m(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[t]=o,s=(e,t)=>{for(var o in t||(t={}))i.call(t,o)&&u(e,o,t[o]);if(n)for(var o of n(t))r.call(t,o)&&u(e,o,t[o]);return e},l=(e,t)=>c(e,d(t));var h=(e,t)=>{var o={};for(var a in e)i.call(e,a)&&t.indexOf(a)<0&&(o[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var a of n(e))t.indexOf(a)<0&&r.call(e,a)&&(o[a]=e[a]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var a=o,{components:e}=a,t=h(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,l(s(s({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`It\u2019s been almost three years since we heard new music from HAIM, the sister trio from Calabasas that burst onto the music scene in 2014 with their debut album \u2018Days Are Gone.\u2019
With their sophomore album, \u2018Something to Tell You,\u2019 HAIM continues to be optimistic and uplifting with their new music. The album is a mix of upbeat pop tracks and slower ballads that showcase the sisters\u2019 harmony and vocals. Even if you aren't a fan of pop music, it's worth giving this album a listen.
The trio had been working on this album for some time before releasing it. In September 2016, they released three singles; \u201CRight Now,\u201D \u201CNew York Excuse\u201D and \u201CSentimentality.\u201D
And after a year-long hiatus following the release of these songs, HAIM announced via Instagram in June 2017 that they would finally be releasing their second studio album (and first extended play) later that year.
Luckily for us, they stuck to their word and released the nine-track EP on Sept. 14, just in time for our listening pleasure. Here are some of our favorite tracks from HAIM's 'Something To Tell You' Album:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The History of Hip Hop Music: The Influential Years

intro.compiledSource:
var u=Object.defineProperty,m=Object.defineProperties;var c=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var a=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,i=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var h=(e,o,t)=>o in e?u(e,o,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[o]=t,s=(e,o)=>{for(var t in o||(o={}))r.call(o,t)&&h(e,t,o[t]);if(a)for(var t of a(o))i.call(o,t)&&h(e,t,o[t]);return e},p=(e,o)=>m(e,c(o));var l=(e,o)=>{var t={};for(var n in e)r.call(e,n)&&o.indexOf(n)<0&&(t[n]=e[n]);if(e!=null&&a)for(var n of a(e))o.indexOf(n)<0&&i.call(e,n)&&(t[n]=e[n]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var n=t,{components:e}=n,o=l(n,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,p(s(s({},layoutProps),o),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Hip hop music is a universal language. It has proven to be a way for people from different cultures and backgrounds to come together and express themselves. From its humble beginnings in New York City, hip hop has grown into a worldwide sensation, with local scenes spawning in cities across the globe. This article explores the history of hip-hop music, from its roots as an underground movement in the early 1980s to its predominance as one of the most popular genres today.
Fans of rap music are undoubtedly aware that this style of music has origins in New York City during the 1970s and 1980s, but there is much more to know about how exactly it came about and how it evolved over time. From breakdancing to rapping, we\u2019ll explore all of the elements that blended together to form what we now call \u201Chip-hop\u201D today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

"The Imitation Game" Is a Fascinating Look at the Life of Alan Turing

intro.compiledSource:
var m=Object.defineProperty,l=Object.defineProperties;var u=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var r=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,i=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var c=(e,t,n)=>t in e?m(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:n}):e[t]=n,o=(e,t)=>{for(var n in t||(t={}))s.call(t,n)&&c(e,n,t[n]);if(r)for(var n of r(t))i.call(t,n)&&c(e,n,t[n]);return e},h=(e,t)=>l(e,u(t));var d=(e,t)=>{var n={};for(var a in e)s.call(e,a)&&t.indexOf(a)<0&&(n[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&r)for(var a of r(e))t.indexOf(a)<0&&i.call(e,a)&&(n[a]=e[a]);return n};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(n){var a=n,{components:e}=a,t=d(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,h(o(o({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`In 1937, Alan Turing was born in Northern England. He would go on to become a war hero, pioneer of computer science, and one of the greatest minds of the 20th century. In 1951, he was convicted of \u201Cgross indecency\u201D and chemically castrated as punishment. Two years later, he killed himself with cyanide. This is his story.
Turing was a brilliant man with many interests that went beyond mathematics and computer science: chess, cryptography, music theory and programming computers to sing are just some examples. This diverse background helped him crack the Nazi Enigma code during World War II at Bletchley Park (which has been nicknamed "Codebreaking Castle"). This saved countless lives and accelerated the end of the war by two years. After the war ended in 1945, Turing continued working as an cryptanalyst for a few more years before turning his attention to other interests \u2013- and it is these interests that led to his arrest and untimely death at age 41.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

However, that doesn\u2019t mean there hasn\u2019t been some brilliant albums released so far this year. While last year had some incredible albums (like Kendrick Lamar\u2019s \u201CDamn,\u201D Lorde\u2019s \u201CMelodrama,\u201D and Noel Gallagher\u2019s High Flying Birds' "Who Built the Moon?"), this year hasn\u2019t quite matched up to those standards. However, we are only halfway through the year and as such, we have also seen some fantastic new albums released in the last few months that are worth mentioning. There may not be many great new albums out at the moment \u2013 but these five are definitely among the best.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

10 Rappers That Will Make You Want to Get Out on the Floor and Dance

More than ever before, people are listening to and talking about rappers. But with so much of the genre becoming commodified and predictable, it can be difficult for new artists to stand out among the noise. Fortunately, just because most popular rap fails to break any molds doesn\u2019t mean that the genre is completely devoid of creative talent. In fact, there are a number of rappers who have been working hard to maintain their integrity while still appealing to a larger audience. If you\u2019re ready to put on your dancing shoes and get out on the floor with one of these 10 amazing rappers who will make you want to dance:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
